reviews.title: Great find!
reviews.text: I just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Aristol - I think it is definitely a great deal and would highly recommend it. Hotel Aristol is a three star hotel near the Guinardo (yellow line) metro station. I would compare it to a Holiday Inn in terms of the types and quality of rooms. The prices are low, it is clean and safe and ALL the rooms are non-smoking!

The Hotel is in a great location- five-minute walk from a cute plaza area with numerous nice restaurants and bars, 2 blocks from the metro, and an easy 15 minute walk from Sagrada Familia. Not in the center of things, but conveniently located.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small hotel right across the street from the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Hospital de Sant Pau". Very comfortable rooms with good A/C. Didn't really hear any ambulances. There aren't many english channels on the TV, but when you are in Barcelona, TV doesn't really matter. Service was very courteous. Didn't try the breakfast so no comment on that. The hotel is located up the hill from the direction of the sea, so the best metro to get off (if you are not taking a taxi) is also the closest- Guinardo/Hospital de Sant Pau, which happens to be the yellow line. The best walk from the hotel is this- turn right when you walk out of the door, heading downhill on Carrer de Cartagena. Take it until you get to the pedestrian boulevard Avinguda de Gaudi (small cars and motorcycles run on the sides). It runs diagonal to the other streets and begins right across the street from the main entrance to the historical part of Hospital de Sant Pau. You will be able to see a great view of the Sagrada Familia from here and the walkway continues all the way to the church. The street is lined with restaurants and cafes and is a very pleasant walk. FYI, a good grocery store is located right across the street from the hospital on Sant Antoni Maria Claret called Bon Preu. You can get tasty crossaints and sandwiches for good prices there to take to the beach!
reviews.title: Comfortable with Good Price

reviews.text: This is a clean, safe hotel. Our room was spacious with windows and a view. Our bathroom was also spacious with 'his and hers' washbasins. The room had a functioning safe which we used with our own combination and air conditioning that went on and off with the room entry card. The reception staff were helpful and we took breakfast in the light and airy dining room. This was good value, continental style with a few extras.
reviews.title: A clean, safe hotel in a good location for a few days in Barcelona.

reviews.text: The hotel is a short walk from the Sagrada Familia church where you can pick up the Tourist Bus. The nearest Metro stop is Guinardo on the yellow line which is just a short walk from the hotel past the new hospital. The yellow line goes to Passeig de Gracia metro which is conveniet for shopping and Plaza de Catalunia. Another stop is Jaume 1 convenient for The Born.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.text: Hotel Aristol is a 3-star hotel located closed to the Unesco Heitage, Hospital de la Santa Creu I de Sant Pau. There are 2 metro station close by, the yellow line is slightly closer and you won’t need to climb up, convenient after a long hard day of walking. It wasn’t centrally located but nevertheless, easily accessed via metro. Towards the night the streets weren’t busy and one could hardly hear any traffic.
reviews.title: good clean hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is crisp and clean, with very friendly and helpful staff. The room was sufficiently comfortable to accommodate two people without invading into each other’s space. It also has air conditioner with temperature controller. Lighting was sufficient. A safe and a fridge were available. High speed internet worked very well, accessible from the room without problem. Downside is no drinking glass or in-room tea/coffee facility. Nevertheless, one night requested spoons to be sent to the room and the staff happily brought it up.
reviews.title: Clean & Friendly.
